Reviews.Title: “Clean....Simple and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: VegasKid49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the property for 2 nights and the room was very clean, inexpensive and very convenient to the businesses that I call on. I have stayed there before and it is always the same.....GREAT! PS: The shower heads are AWESOME! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Happy enough with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DazW
Reviews.Content: Paid about 88 dollars for a room on a Friday eve. Check in was quick and easy - there is free parking at the hotel Room was fairly small but clean and in good shape. Microwave and refridgerator and a the room had a safe which was handy. Bathroom is small but fittings decent. Beds and Bedding clean and comfortable. Our room was on the second floor - didnt notice too much noise from other guests or the road outside which is fairly close. Didnt have the breakfast as we werent up early enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: Thomas D Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location 5 days for business .Room was always meticulous cleaned, exceptional for this class of hotel. Furniture was better than typical, beds very good. Shower and bath in excellent condition. Hotel was crowded with families visiting SeaWorld but nothing disturbing. Breakfast is only for folks who want a quick coffee and toast. Excellent breakfast and Sushi restaurants 100yards down the road. Only real negative point for loosing one point was the extremely slow internet connection (wireless). Was frustrating and had to use 4G stick. Other than that: highly recommended for a budget hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an upscale setting.”
Reviews.Author: ChiTDI
Reviews.Content: Hotel shares the mountainside with larger hotels and upscale restaurants. Cafe within walking distance. Pool, breakfast and hot tub were fine and the appointments in the rooms were a welcome addition to the comfy and clean beds. Located right off I-8, the location was close to the airport and harbor, and offered access to the interesting Mission Valley neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Descent stay”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Liked the place until a vendor slid a flyer through the door while we were in the room. Scared my wife. She thought someone was trying to get in. The breakfast was o'k except for no boiled eggs. Enjoyed the hot tub and small heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “Management covers up intrusion into rooms”
Reviews.Author: oobie d
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in generally good condition and the location provides easy access to the stadium; however, I cannot accept the fact that the management allows vendors to OPEN YOUR HOTEL DOOR and drop off literature to restaurants. I was in the room one night and heard the door lock beep and witnessed the door open only to be stopped my the swing latch. The person opening the door pushed in a piece of paper advertising a local restaurant. When I complained to the manager of duty he basically said that there was nothing he could do and the only people who have access keys are the management. Therefore, I was wrong. I hate to think what would have happened if the intruder had other motives or I had a gun. The manager's name who "assisted" me is Chris Michie Assistant Manager. Here is what he sent me "I was the gentleman at the front desk you spoke with about the issue of someone trying to open your door while putting a flier under it during your stay. As I stated to you we are an outdoor facility so we cannot limit the access to our hotel from outside guests but I want to assure you that there is no possible way that any person who is not an employee has any type of key to any door or building on our property. There is no master pass key that any one has access to after hours other than the senior managers at this location."

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: utahduh
Reviews.Content: This was nothing special in a motel but it was nice, clean, the staff was friendly and it was close to the big attractions. Book it on Priceline and it's really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Loybus
Reviews.Content: For the price, it was a comfortable and clean room. Decent beds. Good location with access to mall. Cons: older TV, slow Internet (Wayport) access, and so-so breakfast. However, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, COLD uncomfortable rooms. Thumbs down La Quinta.”
Reviews.Author: Donny361
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. I stayed for almost a week from 05-10 Dec 2011, and recieved poor service from the get go. I chose this location because i use La Quinta frequently and because of its great location in Mission Valley and easy access to highways. However, this location DID NOT live up to the standards I've come to expect from La Quinta. First, our rooms were VERY cold and we were provided nothing but bed liners for our beds. I requested comforters three times before an attendant delivered bed liners to my room saying they didn't have comforters. He then asked me, "How many times did you request these Sir?" I thought maybe he was going to apologize for the inconvienience and then upon my telling him "Three times," he mentioned, "I only need to be told once, not three times Sir. Here are your liners." I was left dumb founded as i did not give any attitude nor grief to deserve this maltreatment. My family and I set our heater but that didn't work and only blew room temperature air. Mind you its winter and nightly lows are in the 30's and 40's... I notified the front desk on several occasions and even payed them a friendly visit, but no one ever came to attempt fixing the heater. Third, house keeping is a joke and rarely if ever cleaned our room. The two times they did, dirty towels were left on the floor and trash cans were left without liners. I got to the point i was using recycled Target bags and just putting them outside the door when full since they were never taken out in the first place. I got tired of chasing down the house keepers. Fourth, as my family and i were relocating from CA to TX, the last day we brought in a moving truck and car trailor. Upon driving into the parking lot, a front desk employee came outside and told us we were ok to park our truck and trailor in addition to my car in the parking lot. So we left the car and car trailor at the hotel and took the truck to the storage facility to pack it up. Upon return, i was told by my younger sister, 22, (who is a small framed girl by the way) that she was told by the same employee that we were no longer allowed to park there due to the hotel being fully booked and that (the employee) didn't care how it was done, but the car trailor had to move immediately. So my younger sister had to ask another customer to help her pick up the front of the trailor and move it out of the parking lot all on their own without help. Mind you this thing is VERY heavy and it took them over an hour. I ended up paying the guy $50 for his troubles. I couldnt come help as i had a deadline that afternoon to have my storage emptied. We kept an eye on the parking lot that afternoon and during the night, the parking lot NEVER filled up, and in the morning had only 6 cars parked outside. Fifth, Internet at this location is slower than dial up, and finally, the pillows were thinner and worse than ones you would expect at a very cheap hotel. Overall, this ruined my last days in San Diego and I DO NOT recommend ANYONE stay here!!! Save yourself the money, heart ache, and disappointment and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in decent shape and a great location”
Reviews.Author: be32
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old but in good shape. We stayed in one of the two room King suites on the third floor away from the freeway. It was nice to have the extra space of the suite but there was only a couch (pull out) and a desk chair to sit in. Carpet was fairly new, pillows inconsistent. Room had a mini refrigerator but TVs were the old kind, Internet VERY SLOW. I mentioned this to the front desk staff and they told me it was a bandwidth issue. If you need Internet access, I would not choose to stay here, it is way too slow to do much. Air conditioning/heating units separately controlled in each room, they are next to bed and blow on the bed when on. Breakfast area was small. When hotel was busy, it was difficult to get around and seating was very limited. Nice that they had three waffle makers, breakfast staff did a great job hustling around and taking care of everything. The earlier you go, the fewer people. Very easy to get on and off of the 8 freeway and to 805 and 163 north and south. Lots of restaurant and shopping options within a mile. Not sure if I will stay here again but if you need a decent hotel with breakfast, and don't need Internet, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm...”
Reviews.Author: Cloclo_105
Reviews.Content: The moment we stepped out of the car we could smell marijuana. Clearly, somebody in the hotel had been using it. The room was nice enough, but very small. It was clean. It rained overnight so the stairs were flooded and we got our feet wet. Later on housekeeping cleaned it up. Breakfast was you regular waffle maker and cereal, but it was good. Overall it's a great hotel for a quick one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: star_angel007
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference with my colleagues and decided to stay in La Quinta Mission Valley because of my good experience at other La Quinta hotels. The front desk staff were not friendly, house keeping had to be called to fix the airconditioner on three occasions for the same complaint. We insisted on changing rooms but they were not ready to get us another room.The cleaning was not so good either. We had to ask for bin liners at a stage because cleaning lady refused to line the bins. This particular La Quinta did not live up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: happyandretiredkf318
Reviews.Content: This is by far the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in and I have traveled a lot. We spent a little more and got a suite and it was really nice. Housekeeping has kept every inch of this hotel spotless. I did the white glove test and it passed with flying colors. The furnishings were beautiful which surprised me because it was not really expensive . The location was close to a lot of attractions, especially the Zoo, about 6 miles away. The area around is very nice and felt very safe at night. The breakfast served was great and kept very tidy. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's still a La Quinta, but it's noisy . . .”
Reviews.Author: ninshubur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the pet rooms on a weekday night. The pet rooms are across an alley from an auto-body repair shop. The noise was unbearable, and I asked to move. Unfortunately, with two dogs those rooms were the only ones available to me. Combined with the noise from the busy I-8 freeway, the din was unbearable. I had an enormous amount of work to do that required concentration, and I could not concentrate at all. La Quinta is a wonderful chain, though, and as soon as I complained to the desk (and said I wished I would have stayed in the quieter Chula Vista location), the desk manager offered to move my reservation over there. I was staying in the room on points (I'm a dedicated La Quinta Returns member), but he got me on the phone with the Returns reservation people, who promptly gave me back my points and moved them to a reservation at the other place. The whole process took about a half hour, and everyone was friendly and helpful all the way through. Not bad for what's really a budget business hotel. I'm not sure the Sheraton would manage things that well. If you need to stay at this La Quinta because the location suits you better, it's not bad. The rooms are a little small (at least the pet rooms were), but they're clean. If you're traveling with pets, though, and have to be in the room before 6 or 7 p.m., I wouldn't recommend it. I often stay in La Quintas when I need to work, and the desk and chair here was inadequate for that. But I do thank La Quinta people for helping me out. Everything turned out great. The room at Chula Vista was fantastic -- complete with proper work desk and super-comfortable chair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nytexan70
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in the middle of many of the sites of San Diego. Rooms were very clean and nice. They need an extra waffle iron on the weekends for the breakfast area, There are also several restaurants nearby. We enjoyed our stay and will return to this hotel the next time we are in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “good holiday hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: littlechef7
Reviews.Content: stayed here 5th-8th sept with my wife hotel was good no problems,perfect location for all amenities,short drive to fashion valley transit station to get tram/train into downtown sandiego best way of getting around save yourself a lot of hassle looking for parking.car parking at transit station is free so perfect for sightseeing,day pass 5dollars great value.hotel amenities were fine breakfast was adequate cereal,porridge,waffles toast and different breakfast breads,yoghurts fruit and different hot and cold drinks.would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LidiaGrad
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and courteous. The breakfast was limited but adequate and always well stocked. The suite was large and the king size bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. The a/c worked and the blackout drapes did their job. We stayed on the back far side of the hotel and we found it to be very quiet. The ample free parking was a huge bonus and the location couldn't be better as it was close to everything. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: seattleg
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at La Quinta. With the AAA rate we paid $99 per night. The room had two decently comfortable beds (we brought our own softer pillows), a microwave, mini fridge, free wi fi and free breakfast. And free parking. I love having a fridge in the room! I brought my own organic milk and made tea in the room. We were on the top floor in the back. so we heard absolutely nothing from the road or any neighbors. In most hotels I hear doors slamming starting at 7am, but not here. Maybe it wasn't very full. It is a 2-star hotel, so there wasn't much that was fancy about the room. It was just barely big enough for two, and everything seemed clean enough. There was one sink with a just a little counter space, a tight squeeze for two women! But it was separate from the toilet/shower, which is great. The breakfast is served till 9:30am, and as others have reviewed it is VERY crowded. Honestly it's too small for the amount of rooms. We were generally there between 8:45am and 9:30 and you really have to hustle around the crowds of people and kids. Still, my travel mate always got her waffle, and I got my oatmeal. There was milk, juice, different breads, hb eggs, fruit , cereal coffee etc. With the addition of yogurt I had in my fridge, it was a perfectly good breakfast. The parking can get a little tight if you arrive after 11pm, but even on Friday night we got a space. Make sure you check out with plenty of time, because they don't staff the office very well! The location is great! There is a large shopping center on the other side of the freeway if you need a grocery store, ice cream, Best Buy or Target. The hotel is on the side of the freeway that heads east, away from the city. But it's a fast and easy drive with a stop light to get on I-8 west. In light traffic you can be in Old Town, Mission Beach, the Gaslamp, Seaworld or Balboa Park in 10-15 minutes max. Using I-8 and Hwy 163 you can easily find your way around. I recommend a stop at the Whole Foods in Hillcrest on your way to the Zoo to pick up a healthy smoothie and good sandwiches. (-: I have no idea if the trolley or a bus comes out to this location. That is something we would have liked to try on one day because parking in the San Diego neighborhoods is tough!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: The walls in this hotel were paper thin. We heard everything, people walking around outside, upstairs neighbor knocking boots, toilet flushing from every direction all night long. Rooms were great, the king suite was clean, large and set up well. We were on 2nd floor and on end. Breakfast was ok but you had to fight with everyone for a chance to use the waffle iron and i went at 6:30 am. No pet charge was nice. They dont really have grassy or dirt areas around for pets to go had to go to back of hotel (at night) or walk on busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best La Quinta we stayed at”
Reviews.Author: crashLongIslandNy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few La Quintas in the past and this one was at the bottom of my list. -My room had a sofa bed which was damaged. We did not need it but you would think the management would be embarrassed to have a piece of furniture that looked broken in one of their rooms. - The breakfast room was way over crowded unless you got there at 6:30. One morning we ran out of two of the three cereals, milk and 1/2 & 1/2. - The only day we had 2 wash cloths was when we checked in. The other days ranged from one to no wash cloths. I would get them from the front desk most days, except for when I gave up and used a small towel. -Our tub started draining VERY slowly on the 6th of our 7 night stay. I called the front desk and they said a maintenance man would fix it promptly. It did not get fixed , I reported it again before we checked out so it could be repaired for the next guests. I understand this is a high volume hotel in a busy city in a budget area of town. Judging from my past experiences at La Quintas, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: rosacatlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to travel with our small dog. La Quinta is really nice place to stay if you plan on taking your dog. I stayed in a suite and it was a good size and we did not feel cramped. The bathroom was large and clean with plenty of bath towels. The serve a free breakfast with waffles, fruit, bagel, juices, but the line for the waffle maker gets long and it takes about three minutes to cook a waffle. The downfall of this place is that you can hear noises from people walking with suitcases rolling down the concrete corridor. Other than that it was relatively quiet. The location is convenient to shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions. We visited Ocean Beach which also has a dog beach. We had the best time there and so did our pooch. People do a good job of supervising and cleaning up after their dogs. We also visited Old Town and had a hard time finding a place that would accept our dog --even though they had an outdoor patio! We finally found a placed called Barra Barra which allowed up to have lunch along with our pet on the patio. The food is pretty good and the margaritas were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleasant...”
Reviews.Author: Corvettechick67
Reviews.Content: We booked for 5 days because we're from Los Angeles, the rooms are too small and have a terrible odor I decided to stay there because the entire group was there, next time I will booked somewhere else where I feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Friday night in a 2-queen bed room. The room was clean, the a/c worked fine, the bed was fairly comfortable and the shower was very strong (although not really hot enough for us). Breakfast was typical of this level of motel. The only thing that didn't work well was the WiFi -- free, but slow as molasses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: soleilfood
Reviews.Content: We had a room with 2 queen beds. With 3 of us but it was a bit tight at times, but the room was updated and the beds and pillows comfy. The breakfast was good and the location was awesome and so was the price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: jab425
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel directly to book our stay. I was transferred to a 1-800 number and booked my reservations, and gave them my husbands member rewards number. (He works in San Diego and always stays at a LaQuinta close to his work site with no problems) I told the person who booked this stay that we had free nights coming to us, and asked how much my bill was going to be. He said that I would have to find out at the hotel after our stay. We checked into a suite, and imagine my surprise when there was no door to the bedroom suite. I called the front desk, and they said they don't have any suites with doors on them. The living area was directly through a large doorway, with NO privacy. The musty smelling bathroom is in the bedroom area, so anyone using the bathroom walked through the bedroom. It was also incredibly noisy, plumbing in the walls banging early in the morning, and everyone who walked by the room at night sounded like a herd of buffalo. BUT, we figured, what the heck, we are only here for 3 nights, and it is free so why complain. While there we needed some extra blankets, and I was told by the front desk they only allow one extra blanket per room. Luckily, she allowed us the extra blanket. The maintenance man was the person who came with our blankets, and helped figure out the fridge. Kudos to him. He was nice. Upon checkout-I receive a bill for $694.00. ??? REALLY? I informed the man at the desk that my husband had several free nights coming to him as he had almost 100,000 points on his member rewards account. Of course, He said he didn't know anything about the rewards points, and that I had to discuss this with them. I asked for the day manager, and of course, he wasn't present that day. So, my husband calls the number on his card, and they said we had to book through their rewards telephone number. NO ONE TOLD ME THIS WHEN I INITIALLY MADE THE RESERVATIONS AT THE 1-800 NUMBER!!! So, I ended up paying almost $700.00 for a shabby hotel room, with no door, stingy blankets, and a grimy feel. I feel extremely ripped off, and of course, the hotel played stupid. My husband is so mad that he plans on not staying at any LaQuinta again, ever. They may not care about one person (he spends 20 days a month in San Diego), but if this review can help anyone else not make any mistakes staying there, then GOOD! There are several choices in the area- don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lvsigchi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Qunita Inn Mission Valley with my wife and 2 year old daughter. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. The things that attracted me most to the La Qunita Inn were the over-all price, no charge for parking, free breakfast and the location – Walking distance to a to five different restaurants, 5 mins to Old Town, 10 mins to the Zoo and Sea World, and 5 mins to the Trolley stop at the Fashion Valley Mall (we took the trolley into the downtown/waterfront area) Our experience - Upon arrive, we were allowed to check in early. The room was clean and modern (during our stay they were replacing the drapes in all the rooms). The room was spacious enough for our needs. The only complaint was the walls are too thin or not well insulated. Every time our neighbors used their shower, we could hear the water rushing through the pipes in the walls. (Lucky for us they didn’t shower that much) Overall experience was excellent – we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on sleeping”
Reviews.Author: DW0001
Reviews.Content: Recently spend two nights at this place. Very noisy place. Closer on room next to ours broke so door slammed all night long. I went to complain to manager and I was told "she is too busy". Would recommend Motel 6 over this.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money and staff were not very helpful. Never earned my returns either for this pie hole.”
Reviews.Author: ladydiannexxx
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this location I was so disspapointed. The pull out sofa was worse than something that came out of the trash. DOn't think for one minute my child would sleep on that nasty thing. They gave me a bedspread to use because they had no blankets. The Queen bed had no bedspread. The tub did not drain. I killed gray spiders the first night there. Front desk staff not friendly or helpful. Parking is underground in the garage or in a very crowded parking lot. After 10pm you are out of luck to get any parking at all. In addition to all the incoveniences this Hotel offered I never earned my La Quinta rewards nothing ever credited for the 3 night stay in this pie hole from May 28/11-5/31/11. They sure are eager to suck your money from you upon check in though. Also note that I tried to use the pool but each time it was out of towels. I would never return to this hotel. Total Fail!! I don't have a picture of the free standing water in the bathtub since I did not take my camera in there with me. It was gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing we had the SeaWorld package...”
Reviews.Author: kjbad
Reviews.Content: Great location right where several freeways meet, which is good. Right around the corner from the UCSD Extension building if you're in town for classes there. It's close to the beaches/SeaWorld by car, but don't try walking to the shopping mall like they advertise unless you are all in shape and adventurous - you have to cross the busy bridge over I-8 to get there. Parking was not ideal, you have to park near the front of the parking structure to get to the elevators and the support poles obstruct several spaces. If you park closest to the elevator, make sure you have a small car or you will need a lookout to back out without damaging anything. We had a Chrysler Pacifica and parked fairly close, but another guest parked his Honda Ridgeline right next to us and we couldn't get past that truck's rear end -- I had to back out like I was going deeper into the structure and do a 3-pt turn just to come back to the exit! We had a 2nd floor suite w/ a king size bed, which meant an odd-numbered room (even numbers were on one side of the floor, odd numbers on the other). You can hear every noise on the concrete walkways leading to the rooms, so when you're trying to sleep you will hear the late comers with rolling suitcases and the cleaning person's cart when she's nowhere near your room. My kid was on the hide-a-bed couch, which he said was fine. The main bedroom is separate from the couch area, but there is no privacy door so people on the couch that need access to the bathroom have to pass by the bed - keep that in mind if you sleep with little to nothing on. The toilet cycled on and off every 10 minutes or so, very annoying. Maintenance never came to repair it after I reported it - I finally got my pliers and fixed the flapper myself to get some sleep I asked for extra towels since there were 3 of us in the room - we didn't get them until the last day of our 3-day stay. The bathroom vent/fan is wall-mounted above the toilet, don't get too close because it is full of dust. When we first arrived, the windows had sheers and privacy shades. On the 2nd day of our stay, we came back to find the sheers removed! Apparently the maintenance man did this to all the rooms, but now we had to either leave the shades open and have anyone walking by look into our room, or close the shades and turn on all the lights! So much for the view. Friday was strange because the flyer guys are all over the place. If they can tell a room is occupied (lights on, noises inside room), they shove flyers into the room through the gap in the side of the door. The 1st time they came, I thought someone was trying to break into the room they were so loud. After the 4th flyer came through in an hour (3 local pizza joints, 1 chinese food place), I complained to the front lobby. Then it magically stopped. Breakfast was pretty good, get there early because it is like a train station with all the guests eating there. If you don't like the basic waffles/cereal/bagels, you can take a 3-minute walk up Cam. Del Rio S to Denny's. Starbucks is across the street in the mall, too far to walk but a short drive. Room service food quality was good, but the prices in the menu were incorrect...they charged an extra $1 on EVERY ITEM we ordered, which was not cool. Laundry was pretty good, the dryers actually got clothes dry in one cycle. Don't bother buying the soap/fabric softener from the lobby - bring your own or go to Target in the mall across the street. The wi-fi worked well, no complaints there when we needed to look up places to visit or restaurants. I normally don't stay here on business trips to SD, even though it's right down the street from the UCSD building I normally am in town to visit. I wouldn't have stayed here this trip except that I got a great deal on a SeaWorld package, which included stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean, good location, pets stay free...”
Reviews.Author: lg1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week after a horrible experience at another hotel. They were lovely people on the staff, let us check in early and check out late on Monday. We had a King Suite which was twice as big as the crummy hotel and the same price. There was no fee for our dog. The suite has a seperate bedroom area, a small sofa, microwave refrigerator and sink and two TV's. The shower was wonderful. Breakfast was nice even tho it was corwded on the weekend. Very convenient to freeway and not noisy. Definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ALL I CAN SAY IS WOW!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: averyfamily3
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the bad reviews I was hesitant about staying here. But once we arrived the grounds were very clean and they allowed us to see our room before we checked in. For less than $100 a night we got a one bedroom suite that was far larger than what we expected! And a wonderful hotel that allows pets free of charge! Our teenager had no problem sleeping on the new hide a bed sofa and the make your own waffels every morning was wonderful! We will stay here everytime we are in the area. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Management and service issues need improvement”
Reviews.Author: MoFloChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I've been choosing La Quinta for personal travel for years because they are pet friendly. The rooms are just fine, clean, and comfortable. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful at check-in. My stay at this particular inn, however, was a disappointment, principally because of management and service issues. 1) The biggest issue is that there is no process to ensure that every room possible is serviced by room attendants. If you have a Do Not Disturb sign on your door when they come, they will not come back unless you specifically request it. Same if your pet is in your room. Thus if you leave the hotel under these circumstances you will come back and find your room has not been serviced, and hotel management will tell you the maid had no way of knowing you wanted service. Management should assume that every guest wants their room to be serviced, unless there is a clear demonstration otherwise. 2) The breakfast room is completely inadequate in size and staffing. Even on the Monday morning following Easter when the hotel had low occupancy the night before, the room was uncomfortably crowded, people were packed 3 or more deep at the waffle makers, and the one attendant was running herself ragged just trying to keep tables clean. Each of the two buildings should have a breakfast room. 3) The pet area is poorly lighted and apparently is never cleaned. Even if you want to pick up your pet's waste as I always do, you are likely to step in something another dog has left behind. 4) Maids will not clean your room while the pet is there, which is perfectly understandable. But there is nowhere in the property that you can go and sit with your pet while the room is cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: LITravelBug
Reviews.Content: We only stayed the night, but the room was wonderfully appointed with everything you could need. We had a problem with the TV and the repairman was at our door withing 5 minutes to fix the problem. This hotel is close to everything....food, mall, attractions, etc....and the price was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Escapethecold2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and comfortable, and appreciated the Wi-fi, fridge, pool, free breakfast, and free parking. Easy to drive to zoo, Sea World and restaurants. Located right beside freeway, but inside room, the noise was negligible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations for those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: jojofitzh2o
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in our budget and not too far from our main destinations of Sea World and the Beach. Though this hotel sits off of the interstate, we were quite surprised how quiet it was. The rooms were clean and not to cramped. We enjoyed having a small fridge and microwave in room as we took some food and drinks with us for our outings. The continental breakfast was very good. We all loved making our own waffles in the morning! There was a very large selection that kids to adults can enjoy. Our only suggestion is to not be booked right next to the swimming pool. We were two doors down and it was kinda distracting when trying to go to sleep prior to the pool closing. Like I said, we were on a budget and were pleased with these accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would not return”
Reviews.Author: bronk5150
Reviews.Content: Being from out of town, we didn't know what to expect. I did NOT appreciate people stuffing flyers into our door throughout the night. Room is a bit outdated, and smelled musty. Underground parking is a bit tight, but seemed secure. OveraLL i WOULD GIVE THIS HOTEL A C- if traveling with family for vacation. And San Diego is a very dirty city in many area. Not nearly as nice as Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay here as good as first”
Reviews.Author: HikerBiker2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 2009 and Oct 2010. Rooms clean. Beds great. Pool and hot tub were good. Breakfast was the usual stuff for places like this. Similar to BW's. Room AC runs constant when turned on. This is great.....don't get woken up like with other AC's going on/off all night. Good value. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service and overall experience from a frequent La Quinta stay member”
Reviews.Author: mbossom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many La Quintas around the country and have a frequent stay account. This was by far the worst La Quinta that I have stayed at and the staff was not friendly, efficient or considerate of my family's travel needs. The breakfast sitting area was around 85 degrees and made for an uncomfortable breakfast experience. They offered me higher rates than I found on their website when I checked in. The front desk attendant left the front desk for 5 minutes in the middle of my check in and then a new attendant came out to finish the check in. They did not give me a map of the hotel which had a confusing parking garage and elevator entrance. I told them that I had a dog when I checked in and they did not give me a pet contract to sign. As I was walking my dog the next morning a hotel staff member cornered me in front of other guests and without even saying good morning, started demanding my room number and then followed me to my room to see where I was staying. I was then given a $100 additional fee on my credit card and when I asked the front desk attendant to speak with a manager, they told me that the manager would not speak with me about the charge. Since La Quinta doesn't charge for pets, it seems like a scam that they didnt give me a contract to sign and then went looking for anyone with pets the next morning to give fines that are higher than the cost of my stay for the night. I will never stay at a La Quinta hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to La Quinta quality”
Reviews.Author: retrofuturistic
Reviews.Content: This place is not up to normal La Quinta quality. Both mattresses were well past their expiration dates. The room was small, cramped and had a foul odor (although it was otherwise spotlessly clean). The parking spaces in the parking lot are way too narrow. Basically, this would be a fairly decent Motel 6, bit as a La Quinta, it's well below average.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay then expected.”
Reviews.Author: davensd
Reviews.Content: First of all this is an Inn. One step above a Motel so you couldn't really expect 5 star type resort style service.Yes your room will likely face the parking lot, but hopefully not the freeway. Stating that however it's actually nicer then I expected. The rooms were dated but clean. A empty fridge, microwave and coffee maker were there to greet us. Oh and if you care the TV was an older tube type so no HD for you! The carpet needs to be refreshed and smokers stay there even though it's not technically allowed in the room. Location here however is key and being on the eastern end of hotel circle allowed you to be near all of the items that San Diego has to offer. With only a few days to plan and find deals during the high tourist season I'd likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: SandyK06
Reviews.Content: Good Location, friendly staff, nice breakfast, clean comfortable room, would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Lexi_Travels81
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay the hotel is nice, the room is a little smaller than the other la Quintas I've stayed in. There were a few issues with the room, mainly the remote control to the tv wasn't working and there were bloody marks on the curtains covering the windows. We arrived late at night and left early the next morning so we didn't bother complaining or asking for new batteries. The breakfast is good and there are enough selections that you can skip a restaurant if your short on time or money. Even though there was a few issues at the hotel, I would stay there again and recommend it to others. It's close to Mission Beach/Sea World locations and even though it's close to the freeway and an auto repair shop the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: kewlbreezes
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the motel. Their check-in time is 1 PM. I got there at 2 P.M. and they said I'd have to wait for my room to be cleaned. Didn't appreciate the false advertising. The motel was very hard to get to. Luckily, I know San Diego fairly well and found a way to get to it (their directions aren't helpful). But if one doesn't know the area, it will be a hard find. The front desk staff weren't particularly friendly and never mentioned where or when the continental breakfast would be or where other amenities were. The room was small but seemed clean. The interior of the room was either cold or hot and humid. There was no in between. I was either chilled or sweating. It was weird. They have an old, in-the-wall heating/cooling system. I was also at the rear of the property and could hear neighbors far too well as well as the freeway, which was a good 75-100 yards away. The Wifi worked fine. I would recommend the motel if you just need to sleep there and can get a rate of $65 or less on a special. Otherwise, it's not worth paying more.

Reviews.Title: “San D Trip”
Reviews.Author: fordfairlawn
Reviews.Content: Very nice chain.....clean and comfortable.....not too expensive either would go again.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: rlr13
Reviews.Content: My son just graduaated from the marines Feb. l2th and we spent 4 nites here. Enjoyed our stay very much! Beds were very comfortable...would love to have their pillows! Microwave and frig in room. toilet and sink are in separate rooms for convenience. The staff: Sara. Reyna. and Veronica were friendly and very helpful! I ask for many directions or recommendations and they were very knowledgeable. A special "hats off" to Guatlermina the breakfast attendant. She does an awesome job keeping everything well stocked. Their waffles are delicious. Their nice breakfast saved us a lot of money! Give Guatlermina a tip as she definitely deserves one! How one person can keep up on a weekend, needs to be commended!

Reviews.Title: “Room was worth what I paid”
Reviews.Author: AkanaOhana
Reviews.Content: Pleasant service from front desk and housekeeping. Got the top (3rd) floor, toward back of bldg as I requested on reservation. Room type was Deluxe Two Queens w/Microwave and Fridge- room is small compared to Holiday Inn Express and another La Quinta. Though furniture showed age, it was clean and everything worked. Only toiletries in the bathroom are soap and conditioning shampoo. Having free internet, hair dryer and iron & board added value. Liked the price and free parking the best. Convenient location, easy access on and off the freeway. Many eateries nearby. East Bldg is convenient as it has gym, laundry and breakfast room. Continental Breakfast was okay, nothing impressive, could offer more variety. Buy beverages from machines near elevator, the price is right. Would check out the suites in this hotel if I visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jahrulez
Reviews.Content: I am more than happy with the service and hospitality of the La Quinta. I am personally greeted by name from Cho (I think thats the spelling) every time I see her. The entire staff at the front desk are always the highlight of checking in and out. I would also like to thank Willamina from the kitchen staff. She is an asset to your hotel. When my family stays with me on vacations we always stay at the La Quinta and my children ask if Willamina is going to be there for breakfast. I just wanted to let you know that your staff is awesome and I commend you as their manager.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: AmbitiousRN
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was so impressed after reading some of the bad reviews - where did they stay? Not at this hotel. I had a great time. The room was clean, the service was wonderful, and the staff was beyond helpful. Everbody was so nice, I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I will come back, no question. Especially for the price it really exceeded my expectations. The location is also absolutely perfect - quick access to interstates, grocery store and other shopping opportunities close by.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice but not great”
Reviews.Author: 4 Joyful Travel
Reviews.Content: Our extended family had four rooms here for three nights leading up to Thanksgiving Day. The rooms had older furnishings but pleasant decor. The lighting was somewhat dim, except for the excellent lighting in the sink area (which was separate from the bathroom). There were some noise issues. The interstate traffic sounds like a continual dull roar; it did not keep us awake but would be unsuitable for a light sleeper. The outer doors slammed shut loudly whenever someone went in or out. We occasionally heard an undefinable motor noise, which may have been air conditioning from a nearby room. The fan in the bathroom was also very loud but quite useless. Our room had a large mini-fridge with freezer, as well as a small microwave. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The shower head was excellent and there was plenty of hot water, though we experienced some temperature variation while showering. The towels were scratchy. Our kids enjoyed the pool and spa. We had a decent continental breakfast each morning that included hard-boiled eggs, waffles, and oatmeal, along with the usual carbs. The hotel is in a good location but the area is heavily congested. Even though the hotel gave us printed directions to various restaurants and points of interest, we still went the wrong way a couple times. I saved $10 per room per night by rechecking the online price of the rooms on the day of our arrival and rebooking. The hotel will charge you extra for the use of the safe in the room unless you tell them at checkout that you didn't use the safe. Our parents had a suite that was roomy enough but had insufficient seating for a group. The hotel would not help us with this problem, so we had to carry in chairs from other rooms. Overall it was a decent place to stay, but I plan to look for something better the next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms....Great price”
Reviews.Author: luvmyboys9802
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Suite with two boys. The room was spacious enough for one night and we liked that there was two tvs. The boys were bummed that there was no pay-per-view, we usually let them rent a movie when we stay at a hotel, but there was a DVD player for one of the tvs. We liked the freeway access and that Mission Valley mall was so close by. The staff was super friendly and when my husband called about the pool not being warm (they're suppose to have a heated pool) they immediately went to check on it. The only thing we disliked about the room was that there was no door dividing the bedroom from the living room. Breakfast was ok, typical continental breakfast. We managed to beat the rush by getting there around 9am. There was still plenty of food and staff was restocking. Overall would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and good location but old hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveanntx
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights so it was fine. Only complaints was a leaky shower and noisy a/c unit. Free breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value & location”
Reviews.Author: CDK-2
Reviews.Content: This was a reasonably good value and good location for a trip to SD to visit the zoo, go to a wedding and visit SD area attractions. Very typical La Quinta. Breakfast was PACKED with families due to the holiday weekend, so be prepared to wait in line for the waffle station and a table to eat at if you are traveling on a peak weekend. Breakfast had a decent range of options. Parking was free and we never had a problem finding a spot in the basement garage. Room included micro, fridge, coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, TV.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: rob64_9
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights all the staff were friendly and helpful. It's not a bad hotel for the price. The first night we had a queen bed and sofa bed for the kids. My eldest (12 year old) woke up in the middle of the night and complained about the sofa bed. He could feel the springs through the mattress, in the morning we asked to change to a room with 2 queen size beds. This wasn't a problem and the receptionist said they were the same price, I didn't think they were but I wasn't about to complain as the hotel was rather busy. As one other reviewer said the breakfst room is very warm in the morning. We chose to sit at the tables outside. The rooms were clean but don't take your shoes off as the carpets seem to be clean but your feet will end up dirty. We stayed here because it was easy to get to the NFL game. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I'd hoped. . .”
Reviews.Author: voyages9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in mid-August 2009 and boy was I pleasantly surprised! First, the hotel is right next to the freeway and we were given a room on the front side so I thought for sure we'd hear everything. Not at all. We had the fan on to cool off and I never once heard a freeway sound until I stepped outside. The hotel was much cleaner and more comfy than I thought it would be for the price and the staff, with the exception of the guy who checked us in, could not have been more helpful. They ran out of towels for the pool twice and the breakfasts never changed but there were lots of options there and all in all I would recommend this place and even stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Rooms, and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Cranberry5
Reviews.Content: I have a family of 5. We stayed in a King Suite for 3 nights. Upon arrival check in was quick and easy. Parking is a little cramped underground. The light was out in the bathroom and the toilet was clogged. Maintenance was quick to fix both problems. The maids did a great job cleaning up every day. Breakfast had a lot to choose from but was very very busy. My kids went swimming and they ran out of towels at the pool. The room was very big and comfy. My kids stayed on the fold out sofa and had no problems. Plenty of room for our travel crib. I never heard anyone nearby. It was a very nice hotel and clean. I stayed at a Ramada the night before and didn't like it as much. Easy access to freeways and not a far drive to Seaworld, Zoo, or beaches. Great price for this hotel. But I'll probably pass on the breakfast next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great price but FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: Clbpet1
Reviews.Content: Check in was pretty routine. Parking a nightmare. Spaces way too close together and the desk clerk's remark that parking down the street by the car dealer was safer anyway, did not give me a warm cozy feeling. The biggest problem for me was the room cleanliness, or lack there of. The rug was so filthy that if you walked on it in bare feet your feet would be black on the bottom. Toilet overflowed, not that big of a deal except it was apparent that the housekeeping staff did not clean much. They never checked or cleaned the toilet. Just left it. The elevator has an expired city permit (jan 09), which to me speaks volumes about the management. Laundry machines not functioning properly. Had to take my wet laundry to a laundrymat elsewhere to complete. I would never stay there again, and probably will not choose La Quinta in the future. Stayed in a Courtyard Marriot on the next leg of that trip and what a major difference it was. The $ difference was not that much either. The level of professionalism contrast was major.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Horrible Parking Situation, Terrible Breakfast Area”
Reviews.Author: usnadad05
Reviews.Content: Checked in about 5:00 pm on July 29, 2009. Very friendly desk staff. Check in process was smooth and efficient. Went to park car to find out that surface parking area is limited. Two underground garage areas are provided, but the way in the garage is the way out as well. Spaces are very, very close together, so close, that on the second night of our stay, I found the next morning that I had to fold in the car mirror on the drivers side of our car to avoid hitting the car parked next to us. Some cars had to park in the street as no spaces were available. The worst parking situation I have ever encountered. Had a two room king suite w/sofa sleeper. Room was clean, but smaller than I expected a two room suite to be. Sofa sleeper was very so-so. In most hotels I have stayed in with a two room suite, you will find a door which can be closed to the bedroom. Not so in this case. Did not like that. Hotel must have been sold out for the two nights of our stay. The breakfast area each morning was very, very, very hot. Got there the first day at about 7:30 am only to find such a big crowd I took one look and left. Next day, I came about 7:15, same result. The area is way to small for so many guests - a real zoo! So much for the "free breakfast." Got a cup of coffee in the lobby. Room is reasonably priced for the area, but overall I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: vhasouth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the LQ Mission Valley. With 2 adults and 2 teens, the room was a little tight, but we didn't travel to San Diego to stay in a motel room. The staff went out of their way to accomodate us. We would highly recommend this LQ to your family!! Each morning we had a choice of waffles, toast, muffins or bagels. They also had cereal, fruit and yogurt. For a continental breakfast this was good. If you need something a little heavier, there is a Denny's 1/4 mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few flukes”
Reviews.Author: PimaGirl
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice for its purpose. We stayed 4 nights and had a few flukes: 1) Shower handle was stripped and fell off, maintenance quickly fixed but water still dripped and needed more work but no one ever showed up; 2) Maid service didn't seem to vacuum as the same cheerio was on the floor from the first day, we could of picked up but wanted to see how long it would take before it was gone, still there when we left; 3) Dryer in laundry room did not work properly. None of these interfered with our stay just a little annoying. On the positive side, we were placed right across from pool as requested and our rooms were tidied up quickly. The breakfast was awesome, plenty of food. We stayed at this hotel last year and this is reason I chose it this time. I was surprised that there are three restraurants down the same little road and could quickly be accessed via foot or car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: AZHeat200
Reviews.Content: We often say at this la quinta when we go to San Diego. It's always an EXCELLENT VALUE. The rooms a good, very comfortable beds, good location and free breakfast (with make your own waffles). Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area. Centrally located to all attractions. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Indi237
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for leisure beginning of the week, rather than weekend. I was able to obtain a good rate on-line. When I called to find out what time our room would be ready I was informed that I had made a mistake on-line in my room choice, but that it would be no problem to resolve. As it turned out, we were actually upgraded at no additional charge and I got the location on the first floor near the pool that I wanted. We enjoyed the breakfast. As a coffee fan I was pleased to find I could have coffee in my room, the breakfast room and even the office! Housekeeping was punctual, even early. The location is perfect to get to the south outh of town quickly. We enjoyed the whole experience and sure we will return. Oh yeah and while many SD hotels charge for parking (hidden fee) it was free!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: bobomejor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife, father and sister on a trip to SoCal for my dad's birthday. We had two rooms and really enjoyed our stay. Parking was plentiful and super convenient. The wi-fi signal was very strong and the rooms were very spacious and clean. We stayed in rooms with king beds, and a separate living room area with a pullout sofa bed, extra TV, a mini-fridge, sink and microwave. This was great for my sister, as she didn't have a to share a bed with her dad (plus, her TV in the living room was bigger than the one in the bedroom... she was quite pleased). The hotel staff is super nice. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have complimentary newspapers, but the staff DID try to see if they could find one for me when I asked (they didn't find one, but at least they tried). The receptionist who checked us in made me feel very good about continuing to choose La Quinta whenever possible. The sole complaint I have about this hotel was the super crowded breakfast room. Of course, that's not really the hotel's fault, but it should be noted. I had better success the second day, so it may have just been a function of it being a Friday morning. The breakfast was actually quite good, and included cereal, do-it-yourself waffles, bagels, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. I couldn't ask for more. The hotel is located very close to various restaurants and gas stations. On our second night there, we walked to an El Cazador Mexican restaurant that was just around the corner (good thing... the restaurant actually had valet parking, as there was very little parking available!). There was also a Wendy's and an ARCO just down the street from the hotel... super convenient. My GPS had a hard time finding the hotel as it sits right off a major highway, and the various exits get kind of confusing. But, once we got there, I had no problem figuring out where to go. It was very simple getting to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo from the hotel after that. I'd definitely recommend this great place to anyone traveling with family to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “There Very Rude!”
Reviews.Author: mnuno760
Reviews.Content: While staying here the GM is very rude and lacks customer service. He doesn't try to make his clients feel comfortable but feel mad and why did i waste my time and money into this hotel. He has a really bad attitude! Also if your staying there i would advise you not you use a debit card because they always make a mistake and always over charge me nights that i haven't stayed. Till this day they owe my $250 and they don't want to give it back. Very bad customer service. Stay in the old town location in san diego they are very nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again...”
Reviews.Author: Off2CTheWizard
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys stayed here a night over Memorial Day weekend (Sunday night) before heading home to Phoenix. We were told the rooms were separate and adequate for two adults and two children. After settling in we realized that the rooms were indeed separate but there was no door between the two rooms (Wide open). There was noise from above and outside the room all night long. It was so disturbing that I tried to call down to the front desk to complain (I'm not a complainer). I sat for a very long time waiting for someone to answer and finally hung up out of frustration (This was between 8:30 and 9:30PM). Later in the evening/middle of the night there was another round of loud noises from outside the room (Exterior halls) and upstairs. I was tempted to call the front desk again but figured it would get me nowhere and I didn't want to add additional disruption to my family trying to sleep. It gets better... In the morning we went to try and enjoy the included continental breakfast... The place was a mad house with people lining up the complete distance of the room to get food. The tables needed cleaning and we just happened to luck out and grab a table big enough for the four of us as others were leaving. It was disgusting yet amusing at the same time to see the mayhem in what is supposed to be a relaxed environment (Breakfast). We got the basics and out of there asap since it was not something I wanted to submit my family to. Upon checkout, I explained my frustration with the experience and the only words I received in response was "I'm sorry to hear that". Nothing was done to try and remedy the situation. Even after mentioning that I would never stay at a La Quinta again. NOTE: There is a automatic and required deposit for a safe that is in your room. You have to ask for the refund at checkout if you don't use it. It's not much money but the fact that you have to ask for it back... Out of frustration I completely forgot about it until we were back on the road. Upon our return I utilized the company's website to file an official complaint about our stay. We are receiving a credit due to the problems but the manager made it sound like we should have expected all of the noise and mayhem over a holiday weekend... Personally, I don't care if it's New Years Eve, If I visit your hotel for a night I expect to be able to get some sleep... The parking is VERY tight too... If you have anything bigger that a Jeep Wrangler may God be with you when you try to park =) Hope that helps you with your decision. The location itself is very convenient and there is a lot around if you need/want something.

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience at Hotel La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: NagpurJosh
Reviews.Content: San Diego, CA, USA Date: 18 May 2009. Close to the highway. We stayed in this hotel for a day. Treatment at reception was friendly. It just took few minutes before we were guided to our room. It was a room with TWO Queen size beds - Charges USD 90.30 with taxes (We were four adults). Room was well prepared, having amenities like: TV, Fridge, Microwave and Coffee Maker. For all this to be accommodated comfortably, the room size could have been little bigger. Toilet was clean. The internet access was FREE. That was nice. Breakfast was delicious, with good choice of fruit juice. The time taken for the checkout was just couple of moments. The car parking was spacious. All in all a very good experience. We shall stay here again and also shall recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice that we made.”
Reviews.Author: patsy56er
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The service was excellent; the beds were wonderful and it felt like I had my own pillow. What a difference between this hotel and the last one that I stayed at last year. Of course the free breakfast was very nice. We had one issue over a $25 gas card that we should have received for booking through AAA, which we didn't get. There was a misunderstanding about the requirements. After we got home I had an email from the manager of the hotel asking how we liked our stay. I told him that I was very pleased with the hotel and mentioned that not receiving the gas card was a bit disappointing but I would still stay at LaQuina again. He is sending me the gas card. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: LynnBlake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on vacation for a week with our toddler and it was great. The location could not be beat--easy to get to the park, zoo, and beach, plus there are a lot of restaurants and shops (Target) nearby to get food, snacks, diapers, etc. The breakfast at the hotel was outstanding--LOVED the waffles! Our room was fine, nothing special, but it did the job. We plan to stay here again in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience from the time I made my reservation to the time I left the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scinsc
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about the staff at The La Quinta Inn San Diego - Mission Valley. I stayed at the hotel during a conference I was attending because it was less expensive than the conference-sponsored hotel, and I couldn't have been happier with my decision. When I initially called to inquire about the hotel rates, I spoke to Chuong, and she was amazing in helping me to get the best rate possible. Then, when I arrived at the hotel, I ended up getting there a little earlier than expected, so my room was not ready. I was completely prepared to leave the hotel and find something to pass the time until my room was ready, but Chris was so accomodating and actually upgraded me to a suite (for FREE!) so that I wouldn't be inconvenienced. That was completely above and beyond the call of duty, since it wasn't their fault the room wasn't ready (I was the one who arrived too early!). I was able to check in immediately, and my entire stay was very comfortable and enjoyable. The free continental breakfast provided was wonderful, and the free parking and wireless internet service were definite perks in an area where most of the hotels charged for parking. And if you aren't afraid to walk a little bit, the location of the hotel is quite convenient. The mall and various restaurants are only about 1/2-3/4 of a mile away, and the Town and Country Conference Center is only about 1.8 miles away, so it is definitely "doable" if you bring a good pair of walking shoes with you! In fact, I think I walked about 24 miles during the week that I was there, and I loved every minute of it, since the area is so nice and walker-friendly. I am hoping that my travels will bring me back to the La Quinta Inn at Mission Valley again soon, but even if they don't, I will definitely recommend the Inn to all of my friends and family who visit the San Diego Area. Not only was the hotel a great value for the services provided, but they treated me like someone "special" from the time I walked into the hotel until the time I left, and I definitely don't think I would have received the same attention at one of the more expensive hotels! Thanks so much to Chris, Chuong, Veronica, Janice, Reyna, and the rest of the staff at the La Quinta Inn San Diego - Mission Valley for such a wonderful stay. I am so glad that I made the decision to stay with you as opposed to the conference hotel. It was the best decision I could have made!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - near everything”
Reviews.Author: vikswa
Reviews.Content: We lived on La Quinta for 5 nights on our vacation to San Diego and loved it. The breakfast was great and the service lady there was very friendly to the kids. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Its really a place to come back after a hectic day and relax, though it does not offer any views, the swimming pool and spa are nice. Couple of nights there were some noisy ppl in the pool after 10pm and management quickly shunned them. Will surely recommend, more so for vacationer as its nearby everything, literaly 10 mins from all hot spots and does not come in the way of rush hour traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie222
Reviews.Content: If you are used to a Holiday Inn Express or a Best Western, then La Quinta is the perfect place. Since we only needed a clean bed to sleep in at a great price, we had absolutely no complaints. Rooms were quiet, staff especially Gerald and Chris, were quite friendly and helpful. The included continental breakfast was alot of bread products, ie: cereal, waffles and toast. Also, had hardboiled eggs and yogurts. Could use a little more diversity of fruit, however. Staff was always around keeping the buffet well stocked and clean. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate was available 24/7 in the lobby. Outdoor pool was also very clean as was the outdoor jacuzzi. After dinner the area was full of kids and their parents. Location is perfect if you are not looking for a grass and ambience. Across the overpass is a major shopping center. It is within two to five miles from all major attractions. Easy access to highways.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: debstermom
Reviews.Content: We went through hotwire and got this hotel at a great price. it lists a continental breakfast, so i was expecting bagles and danishes, but it also had the make your own waffles which my kids totally loved. The breakfast room was nice and roomy. The hotel is very close to down town San Diego and attractions. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: LIerNY
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is a big plus, as a simple trip to Denny's down the block for three is $30 or so. The pool's not heated right now (not sure if it's mechanical or what [anyway, too cold right now to use it]). Good area, easy on and off of I-8. Front desk no problems, maid service is fine. The motel was not too far from anything during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 4tobin
Reviews.Content: I was not planning on staying in the area , but business kept me around and after a long frustrating day all I wanted to do was find a place to call home for the night. When I arrived at the La Quinta I was imediately greated by Chuong who saw that I was tired and frustrated. She checked me in with great speed and accuracy, Chuong made me feel appreciated and seemed to know that I was having a bad day. My room (266) was very clean and comfortable. It looks to have been recenlty upgraded with new a matress, bedding, and window treatments. I am very pleased with the way the staff here treated me. This will be where I stay during future trips into San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this La quinta”
Reviews.Author: smilingrhonda
Reviews.Content: Great friendly service, clean quiet accomodations and great location! I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Member from Surprise
Reviews.Content: In San Diego for a wedding, we were able to check in early and the staff couldn't have been nicer. They were great. The room was attractive, the sink outside the bath/toilet area was a good design, fridge, microwave and coffeepot were appreciated. Breakfast was good, breakfast room was attractive and spacious. Last year we stayed at the Handlery, we liked this hotel better. Plus we didn't have to pay extra for parking. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Filthy Carpets”
Reviews.Author: Candella
Reviews.Content: I will not stay in this hotel again - the carpet was super dirty, just plain gross. All of our socks turned black from walking on the carpet. We made sure we didn't walk barefoot on it. The rest of the room seemed clean but because of the carpet, everything just felt dirty. If you can tolerate nasty carpet, the hotel is in a good location, convenient to chain restaurants and stores and freeway. You can easily get to the major attractions of SD from here. The room was a little cramped but okay for the price. Room includes microwave and fridge with good free breakfast. Swimming pool was a bit too hot. Several people swimming with us there didn't care for the temperature either. I didn't care for the parking garage. We parked our van there and couldn't get out in the evening because the parking was too tight with a narrow lane. Staff was helpful and gave us some printouts of local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Quinta Mission Valley!!”
Reviews.Author: cherrichapstick
Reviews.Content: I booked one evening at the La Quinta this past weekend and could not have been more impressed. I had been worried about finding a room, because several of the other surrounding hotels were fully booked. However, I was able to book a room at the La Quinta without any reservations. And the room was so much more than I expected. I loved it! It was so much nicer than the Hilton, or even the Sheraton. It had a seating area and separate bedroom with tv's in both rooms, a wet bar with a mini fridge and even a mounted cd player in the room. The hotel even serves free breakfast in the morning to boot! The customer service was wonderful. The staff patiently answered all of the questions that I had. I'm already planning my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Navalgus
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place to stay. A lot cheaper then hotel downtown. By car, the downtown is a 10 minutes ride. Nice continental breakfast included. Shopping center nearby. the only downside of this hotel is that you will need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “No issues whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: bigdog97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the first few days in July up to the 4th of July. It turned out to be a great location for everything I wanted to do in San Diego. It's located near "Hotel Circle" which happens to be within a few miles of several of SD's major tourist attractions: Balboa Park, the SD Zoo, Sea World, Mission Beach, Seaport Village, the U.S.S. Midway, etc. It's also right across the highway from a Fashion Mall and shopping center locations. This includes several restaurants which were easy to get too. As for the hotel itself, check-in was quick and easy. We used the parking garage to park our vehicle, and while the parking spots were pretty small, there was plenty of parking each night we were there. There was an elevator from the parking garage to each floor of the hotel. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, the bathroom small but adequate, and overall a joy to come "home" to after a day filled with touristy stuff. My only complaint was that the fridge in our room had been turned off before we arrived...not sure if it was done by the cleaning staff or the previous residents of the room, but it did take a while to cool down once we turned it on. We bought some snacks and drinks at the Target across the highway. There is also some grocery stores within a few miles as well, if you need to get some snacks/food items. All in all, it was a satisfactory experience. I would stay there again especially since there is so much to do within a few miles of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: mcfatkat
Reviews.Content: I found the LA Quinta Mission Valley more than adequate for my 2 night stay in San Diego. It was clean, comfortable and we didn't experience any noise problems at all. We stayed in a double room facing the car sales yard next door. The complimentary continental breakfast offered each morning was a nice touch, with great selection of cereals, toast and waffle machines. Right next door to the Days Inn and just down the road from a Denny's and from major shopping centres.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IaTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for the San Diego sites and right off a major freeway. We booked a two room suite for $99 night that was great, a little living room, kitchen area and bedroom seperate. There is not a door between the living room and bedroom however. We asked for a quiet room and crib for our infant and were given a room at the back of the hotel (away from the freeway) that was indeed quiet, and the crib was in our room before we were. There is an under building parking garage for no charge. The breakfast was great, typical of La Quinta with normal continental fare plus make your own hot waffles. Used the on-site laundry and it all worked well. There is a Mexican restaurant and a Benihanas and TGIF a short walk away, and a lot of shopping and other restaurants just accross the freeway. Overall a great value and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: JaninSoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta on December 29, 2007. First, let me say it is in a GREAT location - a mall, retail stores, and quite a few restaurants are just across the freeway from the hotel. The negatives? The room was a little dowdy, a little worn looking. But we were on the bottom floor with someone above us who was very noisy. There was running and yelling above us in the middle of the night, followed by what sounded like a full-size refrigerator falling over. It was hard to sleep well with all the noise. Breakfast was nothing special - danish, toast, and bagels, with packaged oatmeal and cereal and some hard-boiled eggs. Overall, I would rate our experience there about 2 stars out of 5. It was very mundane, very drab. And I had read Tripadvisor reviews of many hotels before I decided on La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: GrannyJules218
Reviews.Content: We just spent 7 nights at the LaQuinta. The room was extremely clean and we were happy to have the added convenience of a nice sized mini-fridge and a microwave. The TV was bigger than the ones we have at home, but we were a little disappointed that there were only 35 channels. There was a safe in the closet which we didn't use, but it was nice to know we could use it if we needed to. The decor was very up-to-date and the beds were very comfortable. I think this is the first time ever that I've been comfortable in a hotel bed. They were not too soft but not rock-hard either. I slept really well every night, which is very rare for me. We didn't even realize there was a continental breakfast until the last two days and we did use that service those two days. There was a very nice selection and the gal working there was very pleasant. We had spent the first 5 mornings with friends and gone out to eat. There were lots of restaurants nearby. My hubby enjoyed the hot tub and the pool every morning even though the temps were in the 40s and 50s the whole week. My only complaints would be that the key cards weren't very reliable and that the "ground floor" had several steps. When I called to reserve my room, I asked for a ground level room because I can't walk very far and walking steps is very difficult for me....my disappointment was that, even though there is an elevator from the parking garage to the first floor, our room was halfway down to the end and I still had to walk a long way. I left housekeeping a note that there was no need to change the bedding every day because we were going to be there for a week (in Minnesota it's very common, to save on water and laundry soap) and I believe they changed the linens daily anyway. You'd think that with the recent drought and fires, they'd want to conserve all the water they could. It was nice that there was a computer in the lobby for public use so I had a chance to check my email while we were on vacation. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. It was surprisingly quiet since it's right next to the freeway! Since the weather was so cold, we had the heater running almost the whole time, which probably helped to block out the road noise. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay. I would definitely recommend the LaQuinta. It is a good value.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Quinta San Diego Mission Valley
Reviews.Title: “Eh....”
Reviews.Author: sekhmet109
Reviews.Content: We just checked in. We weren't expecting anything fancy ( when you're staying at a hotel a couple of miles from sea world for $100 a night & all the rooms open up to the outside, you shouldn't expect fancy), but although we've only been here a couple of hours, I'm already a little disappointed. We went to swim in the pool after a very long day of travel, and the pool is very very cold. Can't get used to it cold. Which, fine, cheap hotel = unheated pool, but also it appears that the filters aren't running at all. There were quite a few bugs & debris in the water, and it looked filmy. Then we realized that there was no filter-y sounds or movement, nor was there even a hint of a bleachy smell (have you ever stayed at a pool that didn't at least give you a whif of bleach?). We all grimaced at eachother, and walked out of the water. The room is okay, smells a little damp but not musty. Wireless internet service obviously works, staff seems friendly & helpful, and the location is very hand for people from out of town that don't want to spend all day getting somewhere. So , in the end, probably won't stay here again, but probably won't go through the hassle of changing hotels. That is subject to change - we're in San Diego for a week, so...

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: myshka169
Reviews.Content: We (my boyfriend and I) stayed at the La Quinta San Diego- Mission Valley for two nights. We have enjoyed staying at La Quinta's in the past and got one night for $15 since I'm enrolled in the Returns program and have earned points for previous stays. Room: Average size, with fridge and microwave. My hair dryer seemed to have came from a smoking-room. So when I used it, it was like smoke scented air coming out. Parking: Spaces are small, many cars ended up taking 2 spaces to park their cars Location: Great location on Hotel Circle off the 8, right across the bridge from Westfield Mission Valley and Fashion Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but lacking standard amenities”
Reviews.Author: tqrocks
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I settled on La Quinta based on reviews and price. I booked through Priceline a month ago for the busy Labor day weekend.
