Unaware that "accessible" room meant handicapped we asked if there was a way to get a regular room since neither my husband or I are handicapped. Of course they were completely filled and couldn't accomodate us, but they didn't go out of their way either to maybe try to get us another room for one of the other 2 days we were there. Anyway, the room was designed for wheelchairs, although I don't see how they could have gotten the chair between the bed and the TV stand. The bathroom, to say the least, was gigantic. Very accomodating for wheelchairs. The shower had a hand held shower head, a chair for showering, bars and a phone, I guess in case you fell and couldnt get up. Because the bathroom was extra large, there was only one nightstand and no closet. It was a little cramped. There was only one mirror and that was in the bathroom and NO CLOCK RADIO! Not really a big deal but most hotels seem to have these small conveniences. Also, the room didn't have a phone book or any local San Diego mags and stuff every other hotel I've been in has. I asked them at the desk and they gave me a couple sheets of photocopied papers with information on local restaurants. Okay. Good stuff: CLEAN. Lots of towels. The carpet, the walls, and bedding were very clean. The comp breakfast was better than most. The breakfast staff were very nice and accomodating. GREAT LOCATION!! Close to everything: Sea World, Old Town, Seaport Village, and Balboa Park. Basically I would say this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family on bugget”
Reviews.Author: SnowSanJose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, and conveniently located. The fridge and microwave in room are very handy for family traveling. The included breakfast is decent. Overall, it is a good hotel for family travel.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: JoshG6
Reviews.Content: Cheap, but don't let them fool you - the suitess aren't two-room suites, they're just a single large room. The mini-fridge made a rattling noise 24/7, we never got a working alarm/clock-radio, there was a single remote shared between two TVs, the pool was too warm to swim in, and the keys rarely worked. Pros: The staff was helpful, the hotel is well-located, parking is easy, the breakfast buffet is decent (for what it is). I wouldn't stay there again, but then I didn't change hotels either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Terriergirl
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here on Aug. 5-8, and returned for one night, Aug. 12, before catching our plane the next day. The motel located in the Auto Circle area of Mission Valley. We requested a room on the 3rd floor toward the back of the property (near the hill), facing the parking lot. We had no noise problems from the auto dealership next door. However...there was some pool noise late one night (although it was over by 10:00 p.m., when the pool is closed). Anyway, the grounds are clean and well kept. Breakfast is fine....hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit (although the bananas were on the green side), cereals, toast, bagels, danish, muffins, juice & coffee. What more does anyone need? The room....the2 queen bed room is SMALL. We were squished together and one of the beds is practically directly over the air conditioner. The bathroom is SMALL. The bathroom in the first room was shabby...the fan was falling off the wall and the hook on the door fell off. However, the room was clean and tidy. Towels are thin and scratchy. Check in for the first stay was great; quick and easy. I cannot say that about the second stay. We arrived at 2:00, which was an hour before check in and we were told our room would be ready in "15-20 minutes". Kids used the pool to kill the time. At 3:00, I returned to the front desk to get the keys, and I was told, again, the room would be ready in "20 minutes". This was happening with another guest too. Finally, after I complained about waiting around, I got the room. The best part: when I asked if there was "something they could do for my inconvenience", the clerk at the front desk COMPED the room for the night!!! Great deal! Location is good as far as easy access to the 8. Fashion Valley, Hazard Center and Mission Valley malls are 3 minutes away. However, I wouldn't say you could walk to the malls....unless you like walking over highways. Overall, for the price I paid ($120) per night for the first stay, it was a good value for the money. It met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, pretty bad!”
Reviews.Author: PreferVegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a regular room. Two adults and two kids (10 & 13). Had reserved two rooms together for in-laws, however that was not honored. But that was done months in advance, so what were we thinking when we expected it to happen. Very small room, tiny bathroom. Air conditioner had two settings: flash frozen and jungle cruise. The in room fridge made a sound like a sea lion coughing up a bad Bonita. Room overlooked the Jeep dealership's wash rack and dumpster. Heard every loudspeaker announcement. I think the green Wrangler went for a song. Parking spaces are designed for Mini-Coopers. The garage was just too darn creepy to park in. The breakfast consisted of day-old bread products and fruit, which was okay, but the coffee was lousy. It is close to Sea World, but then so is the Sea World parking lot. Not worth the price at all.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta - Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: JanetSheboygan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 24-31. Had a great room on the 3rd floor at a great price as we booked very early. It was very clean every day including nice fluffy towels. The pool and hottub were a little small but came with plenty of towels. The free breakfast was very good and a little varied from day to day. Would definitely stay here again. Was a very convenient location to all local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: Reservation may be CANCELED!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Left_Coaster_80
Reviews.Content: First, let me clarify that this is not strictly a review of the facilities, as I never became an actual guest of this "Inn". Last week I made a reservation online, which provided me with a confirmation number and a corresponding charge on my credit card. However, upon my arrival I was told that my reservation had been "canceled" and that they had no vacancies. They had no excuse, no explanation, NO APOLOGIES, and did not even offer to help me find new accommodations. Worse, the entire city was sold out of hotel rooms, leaving me with absolutely no alternatives. I have a line of work that requires a lot of travel, and neither I nor any of my colleagues have ever had an experience like this. I received no advance phone call, e-mail or other communication informing me of this suspicious cancellation prior to finding myself on the street and far from home the night before an important business meeting. Subsequent contact with the general manager, Karina Winkler, has yielded neither apology nor explanation, rather exposing a very unprofessional institution which is unwilling to take responsibility for its mistakes. The "consolation package" that I have been promised can hardly compensate for being treated this way. At this point it is clear that they overbooked the hotel, and that I was hung out to dry simply because I planned to check-in late. I would not suggest dealing with this location/company if you expect to find a room waiting for you in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - suite has no door between the bedroom & living room”
Reviews.Author: suz0404
Reviews.Content: Warning - the suite has no door between the bedroom and the living room. This was a problem for us because we specifically need a separate bedroom (with a door) since our 2 year old takes an afternoon nap and goes to bed early and will not go to sleep if we are in the room. I called the hotel when I made the reservation and they told me on the phone that there was a door between the rooms in the suite. However, when we arrived, we found that that was not true. We asked to switch rooms, but they told us that all the suites there are like that. We then had to spend the first day of our vacation calling around to find another hotel room that had a suite available. We eventually found the Embassy Suites in La Jolla which had one suite available (with a door!) and were able to cancel our La Quinta room and book the Embassy Suites room.

Reviews.Title: “Great PLACE”
Reviews.Author: pinkyroyal
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights while visiting area and no complaints.Check in was easy booked into one of the suite type rooms with small kitchen area on 1st floor ,room large with 2 tv's good size bed and safe in room.Lots of room to park cark under hotel or in fronnt of room. Pool heated and most welcome after a 5 hour drive from vegas. Great location 1 minute from freeway and a walk to nearest restaurants and shops near by.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed for 7 nights with only very minor issues 4/12-4/19. Let's start off with the pros: We booked a King Studio Suite on hotels.com for about $50 less PER NIGHT than booking through La Quinta or other travel sites. Give it a try! When traveling with children, I would always recommend getting a seperate sleeping area no matter where you stay. In this case, it was wonderful to have 2 t.v.'s! Our daughter loved that she had her "own room" even though it technically was the room with a couch, tables & t.v. Location, Location, Location...it was minutes from all the things we wanted to do or see. We chalked up the $200 to rent a car through Hertz that was equipped with a GPS 'NeverLost'. Let me tell ya - it was SO worth it! We ventured out more than we would've w/o it. La Jolla Cove aka: Seal Beach(a must!), Seaport Village (---), Coronado, Sea World, Legoland & even Tijuana Mexico! We drove to the border, parked & took the bus to Tijuana for $8 pp round trip. Personally, after witnessing the city as you cross the border and the line to get through customs on the way back - walking is not the way to go! You can save $8 pp or be happy (safe, too) and fork over the money to enjoy Tijuana without all the hassle of border crossing and the walk itself. Ok, more hotel details to tell you about.. The pool was heated..not just luke warm but actually enough that you could plunge right in. The hot tub was plenty hot - sometimes a bit too much. Still, it was a welcome sight after long days on the feet. Breakfast is simple yet satisfying. Free USA Today too. To help cut the cost of eating out, we bought food at Target & Food 4 Less. Stocked the 'frig & (very) small freezer 2-3 times. It's amazing how creative you can get when you have to! Because there is not enough room for a 1/2 gal. of milk, we each took a cupful of milk back from breakfast with a cover to have later on. I also made our daughter a PB&J for later on. Ya gotta do what ya gotta do! They offer underground parking. We chose to park outside only because I didn't care to be in a parking area in the dark. I like the lighted parking area where you can actually see people & even your own room. (if you're facing the parking lot, that is). The staff was friendly & really did the best they could when we did have an issue come up. And yes, we did... And now for the cons: Our hot water seemed to not work every day. It was hit & miss b/w 7a.m. - 9 a.m. That did become frustrating. Especially when you need to be somewhere & 3 people need to shower. They did offer us keys to an empty room to shower because the maint. guy was off that day. (never heard of that!) A short time later, we ran the hot water in the sink & then the shower warmed up...??? It became a joke after awhile. We just decided to make the best of it. ;o) Another bummer - the pool was under repair on our last day. Not that they could help it - but it was a bummer! Suggestions - ask for a room facing the parking lot NOT the car dealership next door. I would rather heatrsuitcase rolling down the outside hall than pages over a PA system all day. Also - we used the AAA card. Saved lots of money at Legoland & Sea World. No deals at Disneyland, though! Overall, it was well worth the $91.00 per night. It's difficult to find what we had for that price in that part of town. 'Hope this helps! Kristine/WI

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for San Diego attractions”
Reviews.Author: ChrisClarkston
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to be based out of for visiting the major San Diego attractions. My husband and I stayed here for four nights with our 6 and 4 yr old boys. The hotel was near hotel circle, and was extremely convenient for getting on and off the highways. It was easy to get where we were going, and we rarely hit traffic. There were many stores and restaurants within a 5 min. drive. Legoland was 40 minutes away and Seaworld was 20 minutes away. The staff was extremely helpful in meeting our needs and giving directions or recommendations. The room doors lead to the outside, but we felt safe throughout our stay. There were a lot of families staying here as it was spring break, but it was never noisy. There is a pool outside, but it was not heated, and too chilly for us. The room was clean, except the carpets could have been cleaner - the kids feet picked up dirt. But the beds and bathroom were very clean. There was also plenty of storage for all the stuff we picked up along the way. Breakfast was your basic continental, and it got busy every morning with all the families, but it was still quicker and cheaper than eating at the Denny's down the road. We never had a problem parking, though it did seem tight at times for our minivan. Overall, it was a good base and I would recommend it, especially for the price (we went thru Travelocity - $99 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: pocooso
Reviews.Content: When we arrived with our two young children, I thought we were off to a good start. There was a popcorn machine in the lobby, and both my girls loved having a little popcorn. I thought that was a nice touch, and initially had a good impression. My opinion changed when we got to our room. Both keys did not work. We were tired after walking all day at the zoo, and trying to get working keys was a huge hassel. My parents were booked next door to our room. Only one of their two keys worked intermittently, but they did not complain. My husband called the lobby, and we waited, seemingly a 'long time' (though in reality probably about 10 minutes) for someone to bring my husband and I two new keys. The second set of keys also did not work, so we called yet again. Finally the maintenance man came, and he also fiddled with the keys. And then I think he tinkered with the lock and looked puzzled, saying the lock was not working. By then, probably 20 minutes had gone by, and my kids were getting quite antsy, as were my husband and I, and my parents. My husband called the front desk again; that time he complained and requested another room altogether. The desk person replied, "Sorry, but we don't have another room available at the same level." My husband said, "Ok, then could you upgrade us for all the hassel we're going through?" They agreed to upgrade us, and our kids were so pleased to have a 'big' one-bedroom suite with two televisions so they could watch their own shows. However, they had to sleep on a sofa bed, which probably is not as comfortable as the two double beds we were supposed to originally have. Everything looked nice, but then we noticed that there were big tears in our comforter. We notified the desk staff; we did not want to be charged for the ripped comforter. They offered to bring us another comforter and an extra blanket for our girls.The shower was hard to turn off completely to keep it from dripping. This place provides the combined shampoo/conditioner in a single bottle. Maybe that's good for the guys or people with short hair, but I would've preferred one shampoo bottle and one separate conditioner bottle. Hallways face the outside of the building, so we could hear people going up/down the hall with their suitcases. My mom said that they were going to charge her for using the safe, even though she did not use the safe; not sure how that got resolved. My dad went to go fill our ice bucket; the machine did not put out any ice. My dad said the machine appeared broken, but when I called the desk staff, they said that the machine was not broken and that it just takes awhile to fill. My dad laughed and said that machine was dry as a bone. My husband went to another floor to get ice. Continental breakfast was quite nice, though a little crowded with regard to finding a table since there were 4 adults and 2 kids. This place was on a busy street with not much to do; to do anything other than go out to eat at El Torito or Benihana's, would've had to get on the freeway. There was no view of anything other than the freeway. Bottom line: I don't think I'd return to this place based on our experience. My parents seemed quite disappointed with all the hassels, and they are generally easy going people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: Biddleonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for four nights and were very impressed. It is located just off the I8 Freeway and you can get into Sea World, San Diego City and Balboa Park very easily and quickly. The room itself was slightly small but had a separate bedroom. The condition of the room was good with clean bathroom and small kitchen. Also included is Continental Breakfast comprising fruits, cereals, toast, bagels and pastries. Good start to the day. Hotel also has heated pool and spa which kids enjoyed. Across the road is a shopping centre which you can walk to. Heaps of restaurants on the immediate area. Recommended and would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn San Diego Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 641 Camino Del Rio South, San Diego, CA 92108
